content.description: Start on the lowest holds you can find. I avoided standing on the obvious crack/ledge at the bottom right just to make it more fun. Once you're established, it's just a few fun, slabby moves up and over. I also avoided the right arete, but using it doesn't really change the difficulty.
content.location: It is on the southern, smooth slab side of the boulder.

content.description:
Spice is on a nice, short boulder and is a counterpart to

Sugar

. Start or the fairly obvious hold. Use some clever feet and some of the hand holds directly upwards until you're standing, and top out.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter to stop from sliding downhill.
content.location:
On the overhang next to the southern smooth red slab, start on the fairly obvious hold that's a part of the crack that goes left and under the slab.

There's another little line worth mentioning for a bit of a warm-up to the right of Spice. Start on the hold that looks just like the start of Spice but is a few feet up and right. Go right on up the jugs, and top out. This is a nice, little line for friends hanging out.
